name: Barbell Bench Press (Flat)
description: Classic compound chest exercise using a barbell on flat bench
instructions:
1. Lie on flat bench with feet flat on floor
2. Grip bar slightly wider than shoulders
3. Lower bar to chest with control
4. Press bar up explosively
5. Keep elbows at 45-degree angle

name: Barbell Bench Press (Incline)
description: Upper chest focused barbell press on incline bench
instructions:
1. Set bench to 30-45 degree incline
2. Grip bar slightly wider than shoulders
3. Lower bar to upper chest
4. Press bar up explosively
5. Keep shoulder blades retracted

name: Barbell Bench Press (Decline)
description: Lower chest focused barbell press on decline bench
instructions:
1. Set bench to decline position, secure feet
2. Grip bar slightly wider than shoulders
3. Lower bar to lower chest
4. Press bar up explosively

name: Barbell Bench Press (Close Grip)
description: Tricep-focused bench press with narrow grip
instructions:
1. Lie on bench, grip bar shoulder-width or narrower
2. Keep elbows close to body
3. Lower bar to chest
4. Press up focusing on triceps

name: Barbell Bench Press (Pause)
description: Bench press with pause at bottom for strength off chest
instructions:
1. Lower bar to chest as normal
2. Pause for 2-3 seconds on chest
3. Explode up without bouncing
4. Builds strength off the chest

name: Dumbbell Bench Press (Flat)
description: Chest exercise using dumbbells for greater range of motion
instructions:
1. Lie on flat bench with dumbbells at chest level
2. Press dumbbells up until arms extended
3. Lower with control, elbows at 45 degrees
4. Allow deeper stretch than barbell

name: Dumbbell Bench Press (Incline)
description: Upper chest focused dumbbell press on incline bench
instructions:
1. Set bench to 30-45 degree incline
2. Press dumbbells from chest
3. Focus on upper chest contraction
4. Control the descent

name: Dumbbell Bench Press (Decline)
instructions:
1. Set bench to decline, secure feet
2. Press dumbbells from lower chest
3. Full range of motion
4. Squeeze at top

name: Dumbbell Bench Press (Single Arm)
description: Unilateral chest press for balance and core stability
instructions:
1. Lie on bench with one dumbbell
2. Press single dumbbell while stabilizing core
3. Keep hips square on bench
4. Builds unilateral strength

name: Dumbbell Fly (Flat)
description: Isolation exercise for chest stretch and contraction
instructions:
1. Lie on bench with dumbbells above chest
2. Lower dumbbells in arc motion
3. Keep slight bend in elbows
4. Squeeze chest at top

name: Dumbbell Fly (Incline)
description: Upper chest isolation with incline angle
instructions:
1. Set bench to incline
2. Arc motion targeting upper chest
3. Deep stretch at bottom
4. Control throughout

name: Cable Fly (High to Low)
instructions:
1. Set cables high
2. Pull down and across body
3. Target lower chest fibers
4. Constant tension

name: Cable Fly (Low to High)
instructions:
1. Set cables low
2. Pull up and across
3. Target upper chest
4. Squeeze at top

name: Cable Fly (Middle)
instructions:
1. Set cables at chest height
2. Bring handles together in front
3. Squeeze chest hard
4. Controlled release

name: Push-Up (Standard)
instructions:
1. Start in plank position
2. Lower body until chest nearly touches floor
3. Push back up explosively
4. Keep core tight and body straight

name: Push-Up (Wide Grip)
description: Wider hand placement for outer chest
instructions:
1. Place hands wider than shoulders
2. Targets outer chest more
3. Full range of motion
4. Squeeze at top

name: Push-Up (Close Grip/Diamond)
description: Close hand placement for triceps and inner chest
instructions:
1. Hands close together, forming diamond
2. Keep elbows tucked
3. Lower to chest
4. Press up, focus triceps

name: Push-Up (Decline)
description: Feet elevated for upper chest emphasis
instructions:
1. Place feet on elevated surface
2. More difficult than standard
3. Targets upper chest
4. Full range of motion

name: Push-Up (Incline)
instructions:
1. Hands on elevated surface
2. Easier than standard
3. Good for beginners
4. Full extension

name: Push-Up (Explosive/Plyometric)
instructions:
1. Push up explosively so hands leave ground
2. Clap at top (optional)
3. Land softly, repeat
4. Builds explosive power

name: Push-Up (Single Arm)
instructions:
1. One hand behind back or on hip
2. Keep body straight
3. Lower with control
4. Very advanced movement

name: Chest Dip
description: Bodyweight exercise for lower chest and triceps
instructions:
1. Support body on dip bars
2. Lean forward slightly for chest emphasis
3. Lower until upper arms parallel
4. Press back up

name: Chest Dip (Weighted)
instructions:
1. Add weight belt with plates
2. Same form as bodyweight dips
3. Control the descent
4. Progressive overload

name: Machine Chest Press
description: Chest press on machine for controlled movement
instructions:
1. Adjust seat height
2. Press handles forward
3. Controlled return
4. Good for beginners

name: Smith Machine Bench Press
description: Bench press on smith machine for guided movement
instructions:
1. Position bench under smith machine
2. Guided vertical path
3. Can use more weight safely
4. Good for isolation

name: Pec Deck Fly
instructions:
1. Adjust seat and arm position
2. Bring pads together
3. Squeeze chest
4. Controlled release

name: Cable Crossover
instructions:
1. Stand between cable stacks
2. Pull cables together in front
3. Slight forward lean
4. Constant tension

name: Svend Press
description: Plate squeeze press for inner chest
instructions:
1. Hold plates together at chest
2. Squeeze plates hard
3. Press forward
4. Return to chest

name: Landmine Press
instructions:
1. Hold end of barbell in landmine
2. Press at angle
3. Good for shoulder health
4. Unilateral or bilateral

name: Floor Press
description: Partial range bench press on floor
instructions:
1. Lie on floor with bar or dumbbells
2. Press until arms extended
3. Triceps touch floor at bottom
4. Good for lockout strength

name: Deadlift (Conventional)
description: Traditional deadlift stance, compound posterior chain exercise
instructions:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart
2. Grip bar just outside legs
3. Keep back straight, chest up
4. Drive through heels to stand
5. Lower bar with control

name: Deadlift (Sumo)
description: Wide stance deadlift emphasizing quads and hips
instructions:
1. Wide stance, toes pointed out
2. Grip bar inside legs
3. More upright torso
4. Drive knees out
5. Hip-dominant movement

name: Romanian Deadlift (RDL)
description: Hip-hinge movement for hamstrings and glutes
instructions:
1. Start standing with bar at thighs
2. Hinge at hips, push them back
3. Lower bar to mid-shin
4. Feel stretch in hamstrings
5. Drive hips forward to stand

name: Romanian Deadlift (Single Leg)
description: Unilateral RDL for balance and hamstring development
instructions:
1. Balance on one leg
2. Hinge at hip, extend other leg back
3. Lower weight to ground
4. Return to standing
5. Challenges balance and stability

name: Stiff Leg Deadlift
description: Minimal knee bend deadlift for maximum hamstring stretch
instructions:
1. Stand with slight knee bend
2. Hinge at hips keeping legs mostly straight
3. Deep hamstring stretch
4. Don't round back
5. Return to standing

name: Deficit Deadlift
description: Deadlift from elevated platform for increased range
instructions:
1. Stand on 1-4 inch platform
2. Increased range of motion
3. Builds strength off floor
4. More challenging than conventional

name: Rack Pull
instructions:
1. Set bar in rack at knee height
2. Pull from shortened range
3. Good for lockout strength
4. Can use heavier weight

name: Trap Bar Deadlift
instructions:
1. Stand inside trap bar
2. Grip handles at sides
3. More quad-dominant
4. Easier on lower back
5. Great for athletes

name: Pull-Up (Standard/Overhand)
description: Classic bodyweight back exercise with overhand grip
instructions:
1. Hang from bar with overhand grip
2. Pull body up until chin over bar
3. Lower with control
4. Full extension at bottom

name: Pull-Up (Wide Grip)
instructions:
1. Grip bar wider than shoulders
2. Pull elbows down and back
3. Emphasizes lats
4. To upper chest

name: Pull-Up (Close Grip)
instructions:
1. Hands shoulder-width or closer
2. More bicep involvement
3. Pull to chest
4. Full range

name: Pull-Up (Neutral Grip)
instructions:
1. Use parallel handles
2. Palms facing each other
3. Easier on shoulders
4. Good bicep involvement

name: Pull-Up (Weighted)
description: Pull-ups with added weight for progression
instructions:
1. Add weight belt with plates
2. Same form as bodyweight
3. Progressive overload
4. Build strength

name: Chin-Up (Underhand)
description: Underhand grip pull-up with more bicep involvement
instructions:
1. Grip bar underhand (supinated)
2. Pull chin over bar
3. More bicep activation
4. Often easier than pull-ups

name: Barbell Row (Bent Over)
description: Classic bent-over row for back thickness
instructions:
1. Hinge at hips with back straight
2. Pull bar to lower chest/upper abs
3. Squeeze shoulder blades together
4. Control the descent

name: Barbell Row (Underhand Grip)
description: Supinated grip row for different back activation
instructions:
1. Underhand grip on bar
2. Pull to lower abdomen
3. More lower lat emphasis
4. Bicep involvement

name: Pendlay Row
description: Explosive row from floor with reset
instructions:
1. Start with bar on floor each rep
2. Torso parallel to ground
3. Explosive pull to chest
4. Reset between reps

name: Dumbbell Row (Single Arm)
instructions:
1. Place one knee and hand on bench
2. Pull dumbbell to hip
3. Keep elbow close to body
4. Squeeze at top

name: Dumbbell Row (Bent Over, Both Arms)
description: Bilateral dumbbell row in bent position
instructions:
1. Hinge at hips with dumbbells
2. Pull both dumbbells to hips
3. Keep back flat
4. Squeeze shoulder blades

name: Cable Row (Seated)
instructions:
1. Sit with feet on platform
2. Pull handle to abdomen
3. Squeeze shoulder blades
4. Control return

name: Cable Row (Single Arm)
instructions:
1. Pull single handle to side
2. Rotate torso slightly
3. Full range of motion
4. Control throughout

name: T-Bar Row
instructions:
1. Straddle T-bar or barbell
2. Grip handles or bar
3. Pull to chest
4. Good for heavy weight

name: Chest Supported Row
description: Row with chest support for strict form
instructions:
1. Lie chest-down on incline bench
2. Row dumbbells to hips
3. Eliminates lower back stress
4. Strict form

name: Lat Pulldown (Wide Grip)
description: Wide grip cable pulldown for lat width
instructions:
1. Sit with thighs secured
2. Grip bar wider than shoulders
3. Pull bar to upper chest
4. Squeeze lats at bottom

name: Lat Pulldown (Close Grip)
instructions:
1. Use close-grip attachment
2. Pull to upper chest
3. More mid-back emphasis
4. Squeeze at bottom

name: Lat Pulldown (Neutral Grip)
instructions:
1. Use parallel grip attachment
2. Palms facing each other
3. Pull to upper chest
4. Shoulder-friendly

name: Lat Pulldown (Single Arm)
instructions:
1. Pull with one arm at a time
2. Can use more range
3. Corrects imbalances
4. Slightly rotate torso

name: Face Pull
description: Cable exercise for rear delts and upper back
instructions:
1. Pull rope toward face
2. Elbows high and wide
3. Squeeze rear delts and traps
4. Control return
5. Excellent for posture

name: Shrug (Barbell)
instructions:
1. Hold bar at thighs
2. Shrug shoulders straight up
3. Don't roll shoulders
4. Squeeze traps at top

name: Shrug (Dumbbell)
instructions:
1. Hold dumbbells at sides
2. Shrug shoulders up
3. Hold at top
4. Lower with control

name: Dumbbell Pullover
instructions:
1. Lie perpendicular on bench
2. Hold dumbbell above chest
3. Lower behind head in arc
4. Pull back over chest

name: Inverted Row (Bodyweight Row)
instructions:
1. Set bar at waist height
2. Hang under bar
3. Pull chest to bar
4. Body stays straight

name: Meadows Row
instructions:
1. Stagger stance at landmine
2. Pull barbell to hip
3. Excellent for thickness
4. Named after John Meadows

name: Barbell Squat (Back Squat)
description: King of leg exercises, bar on upper back
instructions:
1. Bar on upper traps/rear delts
2. Feet shoulder-width apart
3. Descend until thighs parallel or lower
4. Drive through heels to stand
5. Keep chest up and core tight

name: Barbell Squat (Front Squat)
description: Squat with bar on front delts, quad-focused
instructions:
1. Bar rests on front delts
2. Elbows high
3. More upright torso
4. Quad-dominant
5. Core stability

name: Box Squat
description: Squat to box for depth consistency
instructions:
1. Squat to box or bench
2. Sit back, touch box
3. Stand explosively
4. Builds posterior chain

name: Pause Squat
description: Squat with pause at bottom for strength
instructions:
1. Descend to parallel
2. Pause for 2-3 seconds
3. Explode up
4. Eliminates bounce, builds strength

name: Goblet Squat
instructions:
1. Hold dumbbell at chest
2. Squat deep
3. Good for beginners
4. Teaches upright torso

name: Bulgarian Split Squat
description: Single-leg squat with rear foot elevated
instructions:
1. Rear foot on bench behind
2. Descend on front leg
3. Drive through front heel
4. Excellent for balance and strength

name: Pistol Squat (Single-Leg Squat)
instructions:
1. Balance on one leg
2. Extend other leg forward
3. Squat on single leg
4. Very advanced movement

name: Leg Press
instructions:
1. Sit with back against pad
2. Feet shoulder-width on platform
3. Lower platform with control
4. Press through heels

name: Leg Press (Single Leg)
instructions:
1. Press with one leg
2. Corrects imbalances
3. Requires less total weight
4. Focus on control

name: Hack Squat
instructions:
1. Back against pad
2. Squat in machine
3. Quad-focused
4. Less back stress

name: Leg Extension
instructions:
1. Sit in machine
2. Extend legs to straight
3. Squeeze quads at top
4. Control descent

name: Leg Curl (Lying)
instructions:
1. Lie face down on machine
2. Curl heels toward glutes
3. Squeeze hamstrings at top
4. Control the descent

name: Leg Curl (Seated)
instructions:
1. Sit in machine
2. Curl legs down
3. Different hamstring angle
4. Control throughout

name: Leg Curl (Single Leg)
instructions:
1. One leg at a time
2. Corrects imbalances
3. Can focus more
4. Full range

name: Lunge (Forward)
instructions:
1. Step forward with one leg
2. Lower back knee toward floor
3. Front knee over ankle
4. Push back to start or walk forward

name: Lunge (Reverse)
instructions:
1. Step backward
2. Lower to lunge position
3. Easier on knees
4. Return to standing

name: Walking Lunge
instructions:
1. Alternate legs walking forward
2. Continuous motion
3. Good for conditioning
4. Requires space

name: Lateral Lunge (Side Lunge)
instructions:
1. Step wide to side
2. Bend lunging leg
3. Keep other leg straight
4. Targets inner thighs

name: Hip Thrust (Barbell)
instructions:
1. Upper back on bench
2. Bar across hips
3. Drive hips up
4. Squeeze glutes at top

name: Hip Thrust (Single Leg)
instructions:
1. One leg extended
2. Thrust on single leg
3. Advanced variation
4. Core stability

name: Glute Bridge
instructions:
1. Lie on floor, knees bent
2. Drive hips up
3. Squeeze glutes
4. Lower with control

name: Glute Bridge (Single Leg)
instructions:
1. One leg extended
2. Bridge on single leg
3. Challenges stability
4. More glute activation

name: Calf Raise (Standing)
instructions:
1. Stand with balls of feet on platform
2. Raise heels as high as possible
3. Squeeze calves at top
4. Lower with control, full stretch

name: Calf Raise (Seated)
instructions:
1. Sit with weight on knees
2. Raise heels up
3. Targets soleus muscle
4. Full range of motion

name: Calf Raise (Single Leg)
instructions:
1. One leg on platform
2. Raise heel
3. Bodyweight or hold dumbbell
4. Corrects imbalances

name: Step-Up
instructions:
1. Step onto box with one leg
2. Drive through heel
3. Stand tall on box
4. Step down with control

name: Sled Push
description: Weighted sled pushing for legs and conditioning
instructions:
1. Load sled with weight
2. Push with arms extended or low
3. Drive through legs
4. Great for conditioning

name: Sled Pull
instructions:
1. Attach rope to sled
2. Pull sled toward you
3. Can walk backward
4. Full body workout

name: Overhead Press (Barbell)
instructions:
1. Bar at collar bone level
2. Press bar overhead
3. Lock out arms at top
4. Keep core tight
5. Can be standing or seated

name: Overhead Press (Dumbbell)
instructions:
1. Dumbbells at shoulder height
2. Press dumbbells overhead
3. Bring together at top
4. Lower with control

name: Overhead Press (Single Arm)
instructions:
1. Press one arm at a time
2. Core stability challenge
3. Corrects imbalances
4. Can use more range

name: Arnold Press
description: Dumbbell press with rotation, named after Arnold Schwarzenegger
instructions:
1. Start with palms facing you
2. Press and rotate palms forward
3. Full shoulder rotation
4. Named after Arnold

name: Push Press
description: Explosive overhead press with leg drive
instructions:
1. Slight knee dip
2. Drive up explosively
3. Press bar overhead
4. Use more weight than strict press

name: Lateral Raise (Dumbbell)
instructions:
1. Dumbbells at sides
2. Raise arms laterally to shoulder height
3. Slight bend in elbows
4. Control the descent

name: Lateral Raise (Cable)
instructions:
1. Low cable position
2. Raise arm laterally
3. Constant tension
4. Can lean away for stretch

name: Lateral Raise (Single Arm, Leaning)
instructions:
1. Hold onto support with one hand
2. Lean away
3. Raise dumbbell
4. Increased range

name: Front Raise (Barbell)
instructions:
1. Hold bar at thighs
2. Raise bar to shoulder height
3. Keep arms straight
4. Control descent

name: Front Raise (Dumbbell)
instructions:
1. Dumbbells at thighs
2. Raise to shoulder height
3. Alternating or together
4. Don't swing

name: Front Raise (Plate)
instructions:
1. Hold plate at bottom
2. Raise to shoulder height
3. Arms extended
4. Control throughout

name: Rear Delt Fly (Dumbbell)
instructions:
1. Bend forward at hips
2. Raise dumbbells laterally
3. Lead with elbows
4. Squeeze rear delts

name: Rear Delt Fly (Cable)
instructions:
1. Cross cables in front
2. Pull apart to sides
3. Squeeze rear delts
4. Constant tension

name: Rear Delt Fly (Machine/Reverse Pec Deck)
instructions:
1. Sit facing pec deck
2. Pull handles back
3. Squeeze shoulder blades
4. Controlled movement

name: Upright Row (Barbell)
instructions:
1. Pull bar up to chin
2. Elbows high
3. Use wide grip for shoulders
4. Control descent

name: Upright Row (Dumbbell)
instructions:
1. Pull dumbbells to chin
2. Elbows lead
3. More natural path
4. Shoulder-friendly

name: Upright Row (Cable)
description: Cable upright row for constant tension
instructions:
1. Use straight bar or rope
2. Pull to chin
3. Constant tension
4. Smooth movement

name: Barbell Curl
instructions:
1. Stand with bar at thighs
2. Curl bar to shoulders
3. Keep elbows stationary
4. Squeeze biceps at top
5. Control descent

name: Barbell Curl (Wide Grip)
description: Wide grip for short head emphasis
instructions:
1. Grip bar wider than shoulders
2. Curl as normal
3. Targets short head
4. Different bicep activation

name: Barbell Curl (Close Grip)
description: Narrow grip for long head emphasis
instructions:
1. Grip bar narrower
2. Targets long head
3. Keep elbows in
4. Full range

name: EZ-Bar Curl
description: Bicep curl with cambered bar, easier on wrists
instructions:
1. Use EZ-bar for wrist comfort
2. Curl to shoulders
3. Less wrist strain
4. Popular bicep exercise

name: Dumbbell Curl
instructions:
1. Dumbbells at sides
2. Curl alternating or together
3. Rotate palms up as you curl
4. Keep elbows tucked

name: Dumbbell Curl (Alternating)
instructions:
1. Curl one arm at a time
2. Can use more focus
3. Alternate sides
4. Supinate wrist

name: Hammer Curl
instructions:
1. Dumbbells with neutral grip
2. Curl keeping thumbs up
3. Targets brachialis and forearms
4. Control the descent

name: Preacher Curl
description: Bicep curl on preacher bench for isolation
instructions:
1. Arms supported on preacher pad
2. Curl weight up
3. Strict form, no swinging
4. Full range of motion

name: Concentration Curl
instructions:
1. Sit, brace elbow on inner thigh
2. Curl dumbbell up
3. Maximum isolation
4. Squeeze at top

name: Cable Curl
description: Bicep curl with cable for constant tension
instructions:
1. Use straight bar or rope
2. Curl with constant tension
3. Good pump
4. Various attachments

name: Tricep Dip
description: Bodyweight tricep exercise on parallel bars
instructions:
1. Support body on bars
2. Keep torso upright for triceps
3. Lower by bending elbows
4. Press back up

name: Bench Dip
instructions:
1. Hands on bench behind you
2. Feet on floor or elevated
3. Lower body, bend elbows
4. Press back up

name: Tricep Pushdown
instructions:
1. Grip attachment overhead
2. Push down until arms extended
3. Keep elbows at sides
4. Squeeze triceps at bottom

name: Tricep Pushdown (Rope)
instructions:
1. Use rope attachment
2. Split rope at bottom
3. Full tricep contraction
4. Popular variation

name: Overhead Tricep Extension
description: Overhead tricep exercise with dumbbell or cable
instructions:
1. Weight overhead
2. Lower behind head
3. Extend back up
4. Keep elbows in

name: Skull Crusher (Lying Tricep Extension)
instructions:
1. Lie on bench with bar overhead
2. Lower bar to forehead
3. Extend back up
4. Only move forearms

name: Tricep Kickback
instructions:
1. Hinge forward, elbow bent
2. Extend arm back
3. Squeeze tricep
4. Control return

name: Close-Grip Bench Press
description: Bench press with narrow grip for triceps
instructions:
1. Narrow grip on bar
2. Lower to chest
3. Press up focusing on triceps
4. Elbows tucked

name: Plank
instructions:
1. Forearms on floor, body straight
2. Hold position
3. Keep core tight
4. Don't let hips sag

name: Side Plank
instructions:
1. On side, forearm on floor
2. Raise hips
3. Straight line from head to feet
4. Hold position

name: Weighted Plank
instructions:
1. Standard plank position
2. Place weight on back
3. More challenging
4. Shorter holds

name: Crunch
instructions:
1. Lie on back, knees bent
2. Curl shoulders off floor
3. Crunch abs
4. Lower with control

name: Reverse Crunch
instructions:
1. Lie on back
2. Bring knees to chest
3. Lift hips off floor
4. Lower with control

name: Bicycle Crunch
instructions:
1. Alternate bringing elbow to opposite knee
2. Bicycle motion with legs
3. Twist torso
4. Controlled movement

name: Cable Crunch
instructions:
1. Kneel facing cable
2. Hold rope at head
3. Crunch down
4. Keep hips stationary

name: Hanging Leg Raise
instructions:
1. Hang from bar
2. Raise legs to parallel
3. Keep legs straight
4. Lower with control

name: Hanging Knee Raise
instructions:
1. Hang from bar
2. Bring knees to chest
3. Good progression to leg raises
4. Control descent

name: Russian Twist
instructions:
1. Sit with feet off floor
2. Rotate torso side to side
3. Touch weight to ground each side
4. Keep core engaged

name: Woodchop (Cable)
instructions:
1. Pull cable from high to low across body
2. Rotate through core
3. Functional movement
4. Both directions

name: Pallof Press
instructions:
1. Stand perpendicular to cable
2. Press cable straight out
3. Resist rotation
4. Hold and return

name: Ab Wheel Rollout
description: Advanced core exercise with ab wheel
instructions:
1. Kneel with ab wheel
2. Roll forward, extend body
3. Roll back to start
4. Very challenging

name: Dead Bug
description: Core stability with opposite limb movement
instructions:
1. Lie on back, arms and legs up
2. Lower opposite arm and leg
3. Alternate sides
4. Keep lower back flat

name: Bird Dog
description: Core stability on hands and knees
instructions:
1. Start on hands and knees
2. Extend opposite arm and leg
3. Hold position
4. Alternate sides

name: Mountain Climber
instructions:
1. Plank position
2. Bring knee to chest alternating
3. Fast pace for cardio
4. Keep hips level

name: L-Sit
instructions:
1. Support body on hands
2. Legs extended straight out
3. Hold L position
4. Very advanced

name: Burpee
instructions:
1. Drop to push-up position
2. Perform push-up
3. Jump feet to hands
4. Jump vertically
5. Repeat continuously

name: Burpee Box Jump
instructions:
1. Burpee as normal
2. Jump onto box
3. Step down
4. High intensity

name: Kettlebell Swing
instructions:
1. Hinge at hips
2. Swing kettlebell between legs
3. Drive hips forward explosively
4. Swing to shoulder height

name: Kettlebell Swing (Single Arm)
instructions:
1. One arm swing
2. More anti-rotation work
3. Can alternate or switch
4. Core stability

name: Kettlebell Snatch
description: Explosive movement from floor to overhead
instructions:
1. Explosive pull from floor
2. Catch overhead
3. One smooth motion
4. Technical movement

name: Kettlebell Clean
instructions:
1. Pull from floor to shoulder
2. Catch in rack position
3. Don't bang forearm
4. Technical lift

name: Turkish Get-Up
description: Complex movement from lying to standing with weight
instructions:
1. Lie with weight overhead
2. Stand up while keeping weight up
3. Reverse to lie back down
4. Very technical, many steps

name: Power Clean (Barbell)
instructions:
1. Pull bar from floor explosively
2. Catch in front rack
3. Partial squat catch
4. Olympic weightlifting movement

name: Clean and Jerk
description: Olympic lift, floor to overhead via shoulders
instructions:
1. Clean bar to shoulders
2. Dip and drive overhead
3. Split or squat jerk
4. Olympic competition lift

name: Snatch (Barbell)
description: Olympic lift, floor to overhead in one motion
instructions:
1. Wide grip on bar
2. Pull explosively overhead
3. Catch in squat
4. Most technical Olympic lift

name: Thruster
description: Front squat directly into push press
instructions:
1. Front squat
2. Drive up and press overhead
3. One continuous movement
4. High intensity

name: Man Maker (Dumbbell Complex)
description: Burpee with renegade row and press
instructions:
1. Burpee with dumbbells
2. Row each arm in plank
3. Clean dumbbells
4. Press overhead
5. Brutal conditioning

name: Wall Ball
description: Squat and throw medicine ball to wall
instructions:
1. Hold ball at chest
2. Squat down
3. Drive up and throw ball to target
4. Catch and repeat

name: Farmer's Walk
description: Loaded carry for grip and full body
instructions:
1. Hold heavy weights at sides
2. Walk for distance or time
3. Keep upright posture
4. Grip and core work

name: Battle Ropes
instructions:
1. Hold rope ends
2. Create waves with various patterns
3. High intensity intervals
4. Full body cardio

name: Running
instructions:
1. Maintain steady pace
2. Land midfoot
3. Keep posture upright
4. Breathe rhythmically

name: Sprints
instructions:
1. All-out effort for short distance
2. Recovery between sprints
3. Builds speed and power
4. HIIT training

name: Cycling
instructions:
1. Adjust seat height
2. Maintain cadence
3. Vary resistance
4. Keep core engaged

name: Rowing Machine
instructions:
1. Drive with legs first
2. Pull handle to chest
3. Extend arms then bend knees
4. Maintain rhythm

name: Jump Rope
instructions:
1. Jump on balls of feet
2. Keep elbows close
3. Rotate from wrists
4. Land softly

name: Box Jump
instructions:
1. Stand facing box
2. Jump explosively onto box
3. Land softly, full foot on box
4. Step down with control

name: Assault Bike (Air Bike)
description: Full-body cardio on air resistance bike
instructions:
1. Use arms and legs together
2. Harder you pedal, more resistance
3. Brutal for HIIT
4. Very high calorie burn

name: Stair Climber
instructions:
1. Step continuously
2. Maintain posture
3. Don't lean heavily on rails
4. Good glute work

name: Elliptical Trainer
instructions:
1. Smooth elliptical motion
2. Low impact on joints
3. Can use arms
4. Good for recovery cardio

name: Swimming
instructions:
1. Various strokes available
2. Excellent full-body workout
3. Zero impact
4. Technical skill required
